page.title: 09After school
page.content: An area of Blackburn where people congregate is Pleckgate School. After school, around six o'clock the tennis courts are full of budding tennis players - there will be at least two couples waiting to play. who will be knocking the ball against a wall somewhere playing an equivalent of squash with tennis rackets. By eight o' clock there will be at least five couples waiting although some of them will go home without ever getting a game. About ten until half past there will be a few straining their eyesight watching the ball as well as many arguments about whether the ball was in or out. After eleven o' clock the courts and school will be clear apart from the elite few who never came to play tennis, unless they had a game in a doorway or something.
